1:
Lord, you have been our refuge\q throughout all generations.
\q
2:
Before the mountains were formed,\q or you formed the earth and the world,
\q from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.


\q
3:
You return man to dust,\q and you say, "Return, you descendants of mankind."
\q
4:
For a thousand years in your sight\q are as yesterday when it is past,
\q and as a watch in the night.


\q
5:
You sweep them away as with a flood and they sleep;\q in the morning they are like the grass that sprouts up.
\q
6:
In the morning it blooms and grows up;\q in the evening it withers and dries up.


\q
7:
Truly, we are consumed in your anger,\q and in your wrath we are terrified.
\q
8:
You have set our iniquities before you,\q our hidden sins in the light of your presence.


\q
9:
Our life passes away under your wrath;\q our years quickly pass like a sigh.
\q
10:
Our years are seventy,\q or even eighty if we are healthy;
\q but even our best years are marked by trouble and sorrow.
\q Yes, they pass quickly, and we fly away.


\q
11:
Who knows the intensity of your anger,\q and your wrath that is equal to the fear of you?
\q
12:
So teach us to consider our life\q so that we might live wisely.
\q
13:
Turn back, Yahweh! How long will it be?\q Have pity on your servants.


\q
14:
Satisfy us in the morning with your covenant faithfulness\q so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
\q
15:
Make us glad in proportion to the days you afflicted us\q and to the years we have experienced trouble.
\q
16:
Let your servants see your work,\q and let our children see your majesty.


\q
17:
May the favor of the Lord our God be ours;\q prosper the work of our hands;
\q indeed, prosper the work of our hands.
